1.title: Pilot
1.plot: The guys have to find a way to cheer John up after Nikki breaks up with him, so they arrange to go to Speed dating at the local pub. Free beer and lots of single women - what could possibly go wrong?

2.title: Family
2.plot: Ryan's family come to town and everybody falls in love with them instantly, much to Ryan's displeasure. Meanwhile, Mark and Emily have their first date and he gets a pleasant surprise afterwards.

3.title: Jail
3.plot: When Gran is arrested after a heavy night out, the guys have to bail her out. Back home, the guys have a meeting to discuss gran's behavior and how they can get her under control.

4.title: Work
4.plot: the job center ring the guys up and send them on work experience courses, but everything isn't as it seems. Mark and Emily's relationship turns even steamier.

6.title: Party
6.plot: Mark is surprised to get a trial run at a business company up on Scotland, he accepts, much to Emily's displeasure. Later that day, Ryan decided to throw a party to see if he can pull any women.

7.title: Stranded
7.plot: Ryan hits it off with a woman when the train the guys are on breaks down and they're stuck for hours. Meanwhile tension rises between Mark and Emily.

8.title: Mark
8.plot: Mark is left devastated after Emily breaks up with him. When he gets a job offer, he contemplates leaving town for good - will everyone be able to convince him otherwise?

imdb.plot outline: This series takes 3 unemployed guys, sticks them in a small flat with nothing to do except play video games, get drunk, eat kebabs and try to get laid, add into the mix Gran; a weed smoking, drinking, arm wrestling ex-gang member (well at least that's what she claims) and watch chaos ensue.
imdb.title: Slackers
plot: This series takes 3 unemployed guys, sticks them in a small flat with nothing to do except play video games, get drunk, eat kebabs and try to get laid, add into the mix Gran; a weed smoking, drinking, arm wrestling ex-gang member (well at least that's what she claims) and watch chaos ensue.
